derivedData.extendedName: Golden Horde and Successors  1251 to 1556 AD

troopOptions.description: Tartar heavy horsemen with lance and barding
Alan, Circassian, Burta, Mordvin, or Karburdian horse archers

troopOptions.note: only Wallachian, or Moldavian until 1400 only

troopOptions.description: Boyars armed with lances and bows, some with partial plate armor
Lesser boyars or viteji fighting as horse archers
Rustici armed with spears, javelins, axes, halberds, flails, maces, and scythes

troopOptions.note: only Moldavian after 1400; or Wallachian after 1455

battleCardEntries.note: Ambush from woods, hills, and marshy ground

troopOptions.description: Russian, Hungarian, or Cuman horse archers
Conscripts, Moravians, and volunteer Bavarian miners armed with the tools of their trade
Militia spearmen armed with boar spears and axes

battleCardEntries.note: Gulay gorod -- wagons and fixed wall sections between them

derivedData.extendedName: Great Seljuk or Seljuks of Rum  1037 to 1276 AD

name: Great Seljuk or Seljuks of Rum

troopOptions.description: Turkish, Armenian, or Kurdish light infantry
Georgian skirmishers or Rus skirmishing bowmen
Timurid horsemen with lance and barding
Persian, Georgian, or Turkoman noble horsemen with lance and horse barding
Persian, Georgian, or Turkoman horse archers

troopOptions.note: only if  Timur before 1405 or his son Shah Rukh after

battleCardEntries.note: Wagon laager or ditch and tethered buffaloes

troopOptions.description: Mongol horsemen armed with lance and bow, riding armored horses
